page.title: 20Cockermouth Mechanic's Band
page.content: The Band was formed in 1825, and was then one of three town bands. After varying fortunes, the Band was reformed in 1967 and now has over twenty-five members. The instruments played include the trombone, cornets, baritone and tenor horns, flugohorn and euphonium. The Band rehearses twice-weekly and performs regularly in Cockermouth and the district. The Band has performed in Marveljols (twinned town) and will be performing there again in 1986. The members pay an annual subscription. The Band traditionally leads the annual Cockermouth Carnival in June of each year. When first founded the Band was for 'mechanics' from the many small industries found in Cockermouth.
